main event: Unexplained aerial light observed at Camp Wolters, Texas on July 8, 1961.
interesting points: The light was observed by several individuals, including Warrant Officer O. B. F., Warrant Officer F., Captain H., Lieutenant G., and several enlisted personnel.

The light appeared to be stationary in the northern sky and was observed for approximately 15 minutes by Warrant Officer O. B. F., 10 minutes by Warrant Officer F. and Captain H., and 15 minutes by Lieutenant G. and several enlisted personnel.
The light was described as a bright white light, approximately the size of a baseball held at arm's length.
No radar contact was made on the object, and no aircraft were observed in the vicinity at the time of the sighting.
The weather was clear with good visibility at the time of the sighting.
witnesses: Warrant Officer O. B. F., Warrant Officer F., Captain H., Lieutenant G., several enlisted personnel
